etymology.description: 爻(爻) (yáo, "divination lines") + 六(六) (liù, "six") added 𦥑 (hands) -> 𦥯 (intermediate form) -> 子(子) (zǐ, "child") added for differentiation -> present 學 (child learning under a roof)
etymology.interpretation: The character 學 (xué, "learn") combines elements to depict the concept of a child learning under a roof. Originally, it likely combined symbolism for teaching and practical experience with a phonetic component, evolving to emphasize its educational context with a child and a roof element.
etymology.simplification: 學 simplified to 学 by removing the 子(子) (zǐ, "child") component and changing 爻 (divination lines) with 冖 (cover), balancing semantic and visual simplicity.

examples.chinese: 我正在学中文(我正在學中文)。
老师鼓励我们多学历史(老師鼓勵我們多學歷史)，以启发心智(以啟發心智)。
examples.pinyin: Lǎoshī gǔlì wǒmen duō xué lìshǐ, yǐ qǐfā xīnzhì.
examples.english: The teacher encourages us to study history more, in order to inspire our minds.

examples.chinese: 他从小就热衷于学文学(他從小就熱衷於學文學)。
examples.pinyin: Tā cóng xiǎo jiù rèzhōng yú xué wénxué.
examples.english: He has been passionate about studying literature since childhood.
